alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Iberville; Pointe Coupee; West Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 7:26PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of West Baton Rouge, southeastern Pointe Coupee, northern Iberville and southwestern East Baton Rouge Parishes through 800 PM CDT... At 726 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Port Allen to near Ramah. Movement was southwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Baker, Plaquemine, Port Allen, Oak Hills Place, Addis, Brusly, Maringouin, Rosedale, Grosse Tete, Westminster, Merrydale, Erwinville, Inniswold, Ramah, Village St. George, Gardere, Brownfields and Baton Rouge Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 127 and 163. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; Iberville; Pointe Coupee; West Baton Rouge
